titles.title: Help Veterans Own Franchises Act
A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow credits for the establishment of franchises with veterans.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

bill.summary: 9/22/2010--Introduced. Help Veterans Own Franchises Act - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow business franchisors and veterans who purchase a franchise tax credits for a specified percentage of the fees paid to purchase the franchise. Requires the Administrator of the Small Business Administration (SBA) and the Secretary of Veterans Affairs (VA) to provide information about the tax credits in this Act to veterans service organizations and advocacy groups.
